elements.title: Peale's Philadelphia Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that exhibits at Peale's Philadelphia Museum included the first nearly complete skeleton of a mastodon (sketch pictured)?

elements.title: Julius Welschof (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that German factory worker Julius Welschof now plays in the National Football League?

elements.title: Camping in Alaska (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite the success of their song "C U in da Ballpit", Camping in Alaska band members say they all hate it?

elements.title: Jacques Poitras (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that journalist Jacques Poitras spent a month repeatedly crossing the "Imaginary Line" separating New Brunswick and Maine in order to publish a book about it?

elements.title: The Great Mecca Feast (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Krugers was circumcised so he could pass as Muslim and film The Great Mecca Feast?

elements.title: DellaXOZ (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the TikTok success of DellaXOZ's "Ahh!!" prompted a lawyer to contact her?

elements.title: New York State Pavilion (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the New York State Pavilion, one of the most popular attractions at the 1964 World's Fair, later stored hazardous waste?

elements.title: Eve (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Stellar Blade's Eve was described as "a woman born from South Korea's culture and philosophy" by The Washington Post?

elements.title: Tad's Steaks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Tad's Steaks offered "tasty food, low prices, service with a grunt"?
